==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=おいらん}}

===Etymology===
A contraction of {{m|ja|己等|tr=oira}} and the possessive marker {{m|ja|の|tr=no}} (oira no → oira n → oiran). Young assistants used to call their elder courtesans ''oira no'', an ellipse for ''oira no [[姉|neesan]]''. The kanji are {{juku|sort=おいらん}}, from {{der|ja|zh|花魁}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|acc=0|y=i|おいらん}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|おいらん}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic|slang|sort=おいらん}} an [[oiran]]
